text: This is beautiful, its creamy, its orangey, bread and just a great beer. Could drink it all day.
Bubblegum, orange, toffee, bread. Refreshing, had it with a slice of orange, amazing.
On draft in Doolin. Lots of doughy and orange spice, softly carbed, palate cleansing. Had it with fish and chips, will rerate if i find it in bottle.
I love witbier and this was right up there. Very well balanced, tasted like juice at times from the oranges. Maybe a bit yeasty if I was looking for faults.
A very clean and crisp beer, good orange and coriander notes. Light carbonation gives a light pleasant mouthfeel.

Lovely smell of citrus and fresh bed, light carbonation, extremely crushable wit.
Looks a little hazy but still ok for the style. Refreshing.

Bottle. Pours a hazy cloudy Amber orange with a quickly fading off white bubble head. Aroma is of banana, clove, citrus, caramel. Taste is of bubblegum, banana, clove, toffee. Watery to oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation.

Bottle from mchughs. Pours cloudy orange with bubbly white head. Nice head retention. Herbal, dough, yeast, Slight citrus aroma. Flavor is sweet biscuit with a vegetal finish. A little spice in there too with a long slight citrus finish.
Bottle from Martins. Murky orange with a thin head. Aroma of yeast and wheat. Flavour is spicy malt, tangy yeast, dry spiced caramel base.
A malty, citrus aroma with hints of spice, the taste of citrus/orange makes for a very refreshing beer. The palate fades quickly, making you go for the next sip even faster
Great aroma of fresh bread and citrus. Pours slightly cloudy and the head fades over time. Really refreshing sweet and sour taste.

Great refreshing beer. Goes down real easy. Perfect for a session. It has a nice fruity taste from the orange peel coriander. It looks great in the Western herd pint glass with a good head. Not too cloudy.
